user.title: Virtual digitalSTROM Devices
user.description: Set up the integration or add a new device

integration_setup.title: Set up Virtual digitalSTROM Devices
integration_setup.description: Configure the Virtual digitalSTROM Devices integration

device_category.title: Create Virtual digitalSTROM Device - Step 1: Category
device_category.description: Select the category for your new virtual device. Each category represents a different type of digitalSTROM device with specific functions and capabilities.

data_description.category:
Choose the color group that best matches your device type:

• Yellow (Lights) - All lighting devices
• Gray (Blinds) - Shading and blind control
• Blue (Climate) - Heating, cooling, ventilation, windows
• Cyan (Audio) - Audio playback devices
• Magenta (Video) - TV and video devices
• Red (Security) - Alarms, fire, panic systems
• Green (Access) - Doors, doorbells, access control
• White (Single Devices) - Individual appliances like fridges and coffee makers
• Black (Joker) - Configurable/customizable devices

device_config.title: Create Virtual digitalSTROM Device - Step 2: Configuration
device_config.description: Configure the basic properties of your virtual device. Click 'Extended Configuration' for additional optional settings.

data_description.name:
A user-friendly name for your device (e.g., 'Living Room Ceiling Light', 'Bedroom Blind').

This name will be used to identify the device in Home Assistant and digitalSTROM.
data_description.model:
The model name of your device (e.g., 'LED Dimmer', 'Smart Blind Controller').

This identifies the type or model of the physical or virtual device.
data_description.display_id:
A human-readable identifier that would be printed on a physical device (e.g., serial number, device label).

This can be left empty if not applicable for virtual devices.
data_description.primary_group_selection:
Select the primary functional group for this Joker device.

Joker (Black) devices are configurable and can be assigned to any functional group. This determines the device's primary behavior and which scenes it responds to.

• Yellow (Lights) - Device behaves as a light
• Gray (Blinds) - Device controls blinds/shades
• Blue (Climate) - Device for heating/cooling
• Cyan (Audio) - Audio device functions
• Magenta (Video) - Video/TV functions
• Red (Security) - Security/alarm functions
• Green (Access) - Door/access control
• White (Single Devices) - Appliance functions
data_description.next_action:
Choose what to do next:

• ✓ Create Device (Finish) - Save the device with current settings
• ⚙ Extended Configuration (Optional) - Configure additional properties like hardware IDs, vendor info, etc.
• ← Back to Category Selection - Change the device category
• ✗ Cancel Device Creation - Abort and don't create the device

extended_config.title: Extended Configuration (Optional)
extended_config.description: Configure additional optional properties for your device. All fields are optional and can be left empty.

data_description.model_version:
The firmware or software version of the device model (e.g., '1.0.0', 'v2.3').

This helps track device capabilities and compatibility.
data_description.model_uid:
A unique identifier for this functional model in the digitalSTROM system.

This is used to identify devices with the same functional behavior.
data_description.hardware_version:
The hardware revision or version string (e.g., 'Rev A', '1.2').

Useful for tracking physical device versions.
data_description.hardware_guid:
Hardware GUID in URN format (e.g., 'gs1:01:12345', 'uuid:...', 'macaddress:...').

This uniquely identifies the hardware and is used for dSUID generation if provided.
data_description.hardware_model_guid:
Hardware model GUID identifying the specific hardware model.

Used to group devices with the same hardware design.
data_description.vendor_name:
The manufacturer or vendor name (e.g., 'Acme Corp', 'SmartHome Inc').

Defaults to 'KarlKiel' if not specified.
data_description.vendor_guid:
Vendor GUID in URN format to uniquely identify the manufacturer.

Used for vendor-specific identification in the digitalSTROM ecosystem.
data_description.oem_guid:
OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) product GUID.

Used when the device is manufactured by a third party.
data_description.oem_model_guid:
OEM model GUID, often a GTIN (Global Trade Item Number).

Helps identify the commercial product model.
data_description.device_class:
The digitalSTROM device class profile name.

Defaults to the selected category (color group) if not specified.
data_description.device_class_version:
The version of the device class profile specification.

Indicates which version of the device class specification this device implements.
data_description.ha_entity_id:
The Home Assistant entity ID to map this virtual device to (e.g., 'light.living_room').

This creates a connection between the virtualSTROM device and an existing Home Assistant entity.
data_description.active:
Whether the device is operational and can function normally.

When disabled, the device may still be visible but won't respond to commands.

abort.single_instance_allowed: Only one instance of this integration is allowed. To add virtual devices, go to the integration and click Configure.
